Farmer anger spreads in protests from southern France to Brussels
subhead: The protest movement among French farmers intensified on Thursday, fueled by the outbreak of lumpy skin disease among cattle. Convoys demonstrated in Brussels against the EU-Mercosur free trade agreement, changes to the EU's Common Agricultural Policy and a proposed new fertilizer tax.

US Justice Department begins release of Epstein files, including previously unseen photos of Clinton
subhead: The vast disclosure included seven pages listing 254 masseuses – every name obscured beneath thick black bars and the explanation 'redacted to protect potential victim information.' The newly released photographs included a younger-looking Bill Clinton reclining in a hot tub, part of the image obscured by a stark black rectangle.

title: Trump announces lower drug price deals with 9 pharmaceutical companies
subhead: The US President, on Friday, also vowed to urge US health insurance executives to voluntarily lower costs, as millions of Americans brace for a surge in premiums that could prove politically damaging for Republicans.

title: 'Emily in Paris,' season 5, on Netflix: Her weekend in Rome
subhead: The production moved a few episodes to Italy, where, once again, it is the character Sylvie, played by Philippine Leroy-Beaulieu, who delivers the best moments.

title: 'There was a theft at the Louvre because, in a museum, security always takes a back seat to art and welcoming the public'
subhead: Since the robbery on October 19, there have been calls for the resignation of Laurence des Cars, the institution's president. But she is far from being solely responsible for the failures that allowed this theft to take place, argues Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

'It is easier to flatter the people than to serve. Therein lies the last obstacle to an RN victory in 2027'
subhead: Populism has never been stronger in France, but there is a crucial difference between flattering the people and serving them, and the Rassemblement National is currently stumbling on that divide, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: A French farmer's distress: 'I found the first dead cow when I went to the pasture'
subhead: Near Benque, a village an hour from Toulouse, farmer Christian Lasserre discovered three carcasses on Saturday. He fears a new outbreak of lumpy skin disease and the culling of the entire herd.

title: Minnesota's Somali community stands up to Trump: 'We are no less American than other Americans'
subhead: After the revelation of a Covid-19 relief fraud scheme involving nearly 80 individuals of Somali origin, the American president deployed immigration police within the large Somali community in Minnesota, whose members are predominantly US citizens.
